title: JetBlue-Spirit Deal Goes One Complication Too Far
sub_head: New York-based carrier needs acquisitions to grow but the expense of integration makes its proposal to acquire Spirit unappealing for investors
body:
In airline mergers as in acrobatic flying, some maneuvers are too difficult for comfort.
Late Tuesday, the race to acquire Florida-based Spirit Airlines heated up when JetBlue Airways announced an all-cash purchase proposal worth $3.6 billion, or $33 a share. This tops the cash-and-stock deal offered by Frontier Group back in February, which based on Mondayâ€™s market close would pay about $24 a share.
